senses.de: The person one is married to
senses.ex: My spouse and I are going on vacation next week

Tips.title: Equal Relationship
Tips.description: Refers to your married partner, without specifying gender or role.
Tips.example: Do you and your spouse share household chores equally?

Tips.title: Emotionally Charged
Tips.description: Can imply a close, intimate bond, more than just a legal connection.
Tips.example: I told my spouse about my deepest fears last night.

Tips.title: Personal Narratives
Tips.description: Often used when discussing personal life stories or experiences.
Tips.example: My spouse and I met in college and have been together since.

senses.de: A husband or wife, in legal terms
senses.ex: The inheritance will be given to the surviving spouse

Tips.title: Legal Significance
Tips.description: Indicates a legal marriage recognized by government or law.
Tips.example: Her will stated everything should go to her spouse.

Tips.title: Inheritance Context
Tips.description: Commonly used in legal situations like wills or inheritance rights.
Tips.example: As his spouse, you have the right to claim the estate.

Tips.title: Marriage Status
Tips.description: Connotes current marriage; doesn't apply to past relationships/divorces.
Tips.example: Please state the name of your current legal spouse.

Beloved.wordDefinition:
Beloved is an affectionate term used to describe someone you love deeply or hold dear to your heart.

Beloved is a term of endearment that can be used for anyone you love deeply, while spouse is a legal term that describes a husband or wife in a marital relationship.

Comrade.wordDefinition:
Comrade refers to a close friend or ally, often used in reference to people who share the same beliefs, goals, or membership in a group such as soldiers or members of a political party.

Comrade refers to a friend or ally in a broader sense, while spouse refers specifically to a married partner.

Consort.wordDefinition:
Consort, on the other hand, can be used more broadly to refer to any person with whom someone is closely associated or in partnership with, particularly in a non-romantic or non-marital context.

So, while spouse is generally used to refer to a partner in a marriage, consort is a more general term for a partner or companion.

Helpmate.wordDefinition:
Both words, helpmate and spouse, refer to a person's partner in marriage.

However, the word helpmate specifically emphasizes the idea of a partner who provides support and assistance in daily life and may often be used in a religious context.

Overall, both words are applicable in marriage, but helpmate may emphasize the idea of partnership and collaboration more explicitly.

Mate.wordDefinition:
Mate can refer to a friend, a companion or a romantic partner. It is a less formal term and is generally used in informal situations.

Generally, mate is used more in casual conversations while spouse is used to refer to a partner in more serious or official contexts.

Paramour.wordDefinition:
Spouse refers to a person who is legally married to someone else. While the word paramour refers to a person who is in a romantic or sexual relationship with someone who is married to someone else.

A spouse is applicable when referring to a legally married partner, while a paramour applies when referring to an affair or extramarital relationship.

Partner.wordDefinition:
Partner usually refers to someone who you are in a romantic relationship with, but not necessarily married to.

If someone is in a serious relationship but not married, they would typically use the word partner. But if they are legally married, they would use the word spouse.

Soulmate.wordDefinition:
A soulmate is someone you connect with on a deep level, often a romantic partner, who you feel a sense of spiritual or emotional unity with.

A spouse is someone you are legally married to or in a committed partnership with. While a spouse can also be your soulmate, they don't have to be.

You can have a soulmate who is not your spouse and a spouse who is not your soulmate. The term soulmate is often used to describe a romantic relationship, while spouse is a more formal term used to describe someone you are officially committed to.

quotes.Text: Marrying Jared was the best decision I've ever made. You realize in life, not that many things matter that much, but your choice of a spouse is everything. We're truly partners - he supports my work and my ambitions. I know that he's always got my back, and I've got his.
quotes.Title: American Businesswoman
quotes.Name: Ivanka Trump

quotes.Text: When you're married, the person you would most like to love you is your spouse. And if you feel loved by your spouse, the world looks bright. But if the love tank is empty, and you don't feel loved by your spouse, the world begins to look dark.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Gary Chapman

quotes.Text: In a relationship where finances are shared, it's important that both people know what's going on. If one spouse likes being the family accountant, it's fine for that person to take the lead, but the other spouse shouldn't be in the dark.
quotes.Title: American Journalist
quotes.Name: Jean Chatzky

quotes.Text: A word of encouragement from a teacher to a child can change a life. A word of encouragement from a spouse can save a marriage. A word of encouragement from a leader can inspire a person to reach her potential.
quotes.Title: American Clergyman
quotes.Name: John C. Maxwell

quotes.Text: Over the years I've seen people lose a spouse and then withdraw and lose interest in life, and I believe we need to resist that.
quotes.Title: American Clergyman
quotes.Name: Billy Graham

quotes.Text: No one should be denied the opportunity to choose his or her spouse. It is a basic human right and deeply personal decision.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Jared Polis

quotes.Text: We share responsibility. It's important to have a good spouse; that's where I sympathize with single parents.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Hunter Tylo

quotes.Text: When your spouse becomes a congressperson, you have to adjust your entire life if you want to stay married.
quotes.Title: American Educator
quotes.Name: Jane O'Meara Sanders

quotes.Text: Nice people with common sense do not make interesting characters. They only make good former spouses.
quotes.Title: Chilean Writer
quotes.Name: Isabel Allende

quotes.Text: It's important to take time for your spouse and nurture the relationship.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Christina Aguilera
